alert.note: Alert for Durham (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 01 at 12:50AM EDT until July 01 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Raleigh has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Durham County in central North Carolina... * Until 200 AM EDT. * At 1250 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicate that heavy rain from earlier thunderstorms over the warned area continue to produce flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Durham officials report continued high water and areas of street flooding across the city. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Durham, Chapel Hill, Bethesda, Parkwood, Research Triangle, Eno River State Park, Rollingview Marina, Falls Lake and Jordan Lake. This includes the following flood prone locations... Fayetteville St at E Pilot St, Hwy 15-501 Business & Durham-Chapel Hill Blvd, University and Durham-Chapel Hill Blvd, Hillandale Rd at Ellerbe Creek, Stagecoach Rd, Cole Mill Rd at I-85, Club Blvd, Hillandale Rd near Sprunt Ave, Old Oxford Rd near Dearborn Drive, Dearborn Dr between Usher St and Thelma St, University Dr at Forest Hills, and S. Roxboro Rd at the Durham Freeway. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
